physical_findings: Large reddish mass within the nasal fossa, filling the nasal vestibule
Enlarging neck mass causing tracheal deviation

CT: Large, homogeneous soft-tissue mass of the right nasal fossa without calcifications
Destruction of the nasal septum, medial wall of the orbit, and roof of the ethmoid
Voluminous homogeneous mass without calcifications, expanding the right nasal fossa and destroying the nasal septum and the lamina papiracea
Extension into the superior orbital fissure
Soft tissue mass filling the right nasal cavity and right maxillary sinus
MRI: Large soft-tissue mass of intermediate signal intensity on T1-weighted and T2-weighted imaging
Maximal enhancement within the first 30 seconds after contrast medium administration
Tumor had invaded the right pterygopalatine fossa and the orbit, with wide involvement of the extraconal fat
Right optical nerve was stretched with dilatation of its arachnoid sheath
Large necrotic intratumoral areas (after chemo- and radiotherapy)
PET/CT: Hypermetabolic left neck mass arising from the thyroid gland, extending into the mediastinum, and deviating the airway to the right
Hypermetabolic right maxillary sinus with high-density contents
No other hypermetabolic sites were seen

required: Histologic findings: very rich tumoral vascularization and a uniform population of cells with round-to-oval nuclei, inconspicuous nucleoli, evenly dispersed chromatin, ill-defined cytoplasm, abundant mitotic activity
Positive markers for cytokeratin, synaptophysin, chromogranin, and CK20 (perinuclear dot-like pattern)
Positive Merkel cell polyomavirus (in some cases)
supportive: Imaging findings consistent with a hypervascular mass in the nasal fossa
Clinical presentation with nasal obstruction, rhinorrhea, and/or visual disturbances
